text:
Sanitary workers, who were deputed from across the State to clean the flood devastated Chennai, have moved the Madras High Court seeking direction to the State government to pay Rs. 1,650 per day to all such workers in addition to their regular pay. Admitting the petition moved by Dr. Ambedkar SC/ ST Sanitary Workers Association, represented by its State president, R. Anbuventhan, Justice K. Kalyanasundaram, ordered notice to the government returnable in two weeks.

Mr. Anbuventhan submitted that due to the unprecedented downpour huge pile of garbage and other waste stagnated in Chennai, including carcasses cattle and pet animals. As part of the flood relief, the State government mobilised sanitary workers from across the State to clean the city.

“Though there was no official order, the government promised that an additional sum of Rs. 2,000 will be provided for permanent workers and Rs. 300 for daily workers who were involved in the cleaning work,” the petitioner said.

The petitioner alleged that the workers were made to stay in places with inadequate facilities.

“They had to work 12 hours per day. No proper food was provided to them. The job was most hazardous in nature but no safety gadgets were provided.”

Claiming that the additional amount fixed by the government was not sufficient considering the nature of their job, the association wanted the court to direct the government to enhance the compensation.

They seek a direction to government to pay Rs. 1,650 per day in addition
title: Sanitary workers involved in flood relief move HC for better compensation
